availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John B. Chamberlain (Lanncaster, Pennsylvania, druggist; pvt, hosp steward, ass't surgeon 79th PA Inf USA)

body.p: Lancaster, Pennsylvania, druggist and soldier. Pennsylvania native. Son of Mary Chamberlain. Druggist in Lancaster County, Pennsylvania, in 1860. Served in the 79th Pennsylvania Infantry (U.S.A.) as private and hospital steward from February 23, 1862. Served in the 9th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as assistant surgeon from January 19, 1863, to April 16, 1863.
